title: S. R. Srinivasa Varadhan
summary: Sathamangalam Ranga Iyengar Srinivasa Varadhan, FRS (born 2 January 1940) is an Indian American mathematician, widely recognised as one of the most influential mathematicians of the 20th century.[1] He is known for his fundamental contributions to probability theory and in particular for creating a unified theory of large deviations.[2] He is regarded and revered as one of the fundamental contributors to the theory of diffusion processes with an orientation towards the refinement and further development of Itô’s stochastic calculus.[3] In the year 2007, he became the first Asian to win the Abel Prize.[4][5]
